intro: Phaeomeria laotica, commonly known as the Laotian phaeomeria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Laos. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are usually pink or red. Phaeomeria laotica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
